name: Morrison Main Library
description: The Morrison Main Library is the largest library on campus with over 500,000 volumes and 200 study seats. It houses the general collection, periodicals archive, and a dedicated quiet study zone on the third floor. The library also offers interlibrary loan services and research consultation appointments.
additional_info: Free printing: 50 pages per semester per student
Group study rooms can be reserved online up to 7 days in advance
24-hour access during finals week (last two weeks of each semester)
Laptop lending program available at the front desk

name: Chen Science & Engineering Library
description: The Chen Science & Engineering Library specializes in STEM resources including technical journals, conference proceedings, and digital databases like IEEE Xplore and ACM Digital Library. It has 80 study seats and 20 computer workstations with specialized software.
additional_info: Access to IEEE Xplore, ACM Digital Library, and SpringerLink
3D printing service available (submit jobs at the help desk)
Technical writing workshops held every Wednesday at 3 PM
Quiet study zone on the mezzanine level

name: Harper Digital Media Library
description: The Harper Digital Media Library provides access to multimedia resources, streaming databases, and creative software. It includes audio/video editing suites, a podcast recording booth, and a digital archives collection spanning campus history.
additional_info: Four audio/video editing suites available by reservation
Podcast recording booth (1-hour slots, book online)
Access to Kanopy, Criterion, and campus digital archives
Equipment checkout: cameras, microphones, tripods

name: Turing Computer Science Lab
description: The Turing CS Lab is the primary computer lab for computer science students. It has 60 high-performance workstations running Ubuntu Linux and Windows dual-boot, with development tools including VS Code, IntelliJ, and PyCharm pre-installed. The lab also has a dedicated GPU cluster section for machine learning coursework.
additional_info: Access requires valid student ID and CS department enrollment
GPU cluster (8x NVIDIA RTX 4090) available for ML coursework — sign up with TA
Lab monitors on duty during all open hours
Printing available: black & white and color (charges apply for color)

name: Franklin Engineering Lab
description: The Franklin Engineering Lab provides 40 workstations equipped with engineering software including MATLAB, SolidWorks, AutoCAD, and ANSYS. The lab supports coursework for electrical, mechanical, and civil engineering programs and includes a hardware prototyping section.
additional_info: MATLAB, SolidWorks, AutoCAD, ANSYS, and LabVIEW installed on all machines
Hardware prototyping bench with oscilloscopes and soldering stations
Access requires engineering department enrollment
TA help sessions: Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-6 PM

name: Innovation Makerspace
location: Student Union, Lower Level, Room B05
description: The Innovation Makerspace is open to all students and provides access to 3D printers, laser cutters, CNC machines, and electronics workbenches. Staff members offer training sessions for equipment use. It serves both academic projects and personal creative work.
additional_info: Open to all students regardless of major
Mandatory safety orientation required before first use
3D printers: 4x Prusa MK4, 2x resin printers
Laser cutter, CNC router, and vinyl cutter available
Materials available for purchase at cost

name: Data Science & AI Research Lab
description: The Data Science & AI Research Lab is a graduate-level facility for advanced research in machine learning, natural language processing, and computer vision. It houses a dedicated compute cluster and is supervised by faculty from the CS and Statistics departments.
additional_info: Access restricted to graduate students and approved undergrad researchers
Dedicated compute cluster: 4 nodes with A100 GPUs
Weekly research seminar: Fridays at 2 PM
Contact Dr. Patel (rpatel@university.edu) for access requests

name: University Commons Dining Hall
description: The University Commons is the main dining hall on campus, offering all-you-can-eat buffet-style service. It features rotating daily menus with international cuisine stations, a salad bar, grill station, and dedicated allergen-free and vegan options.
additional_info: Accepts meal plan swipes, dining dollars, and credit/debit cards
Allergen-free station and full vegan/vegetarian options daily
Nutrition information posted at each station and online
Meal plan: Unlimited swipes with any residential plan

name: Byte Café
description: Byte Café is a popular coffee shop and quick-service eatery located in the CS building. It serves espresso drinks, teas, pastries, sandwiches, and grab-and-go meals. Known for strong coffee and a relaxed atmosphere popular with CS and engineering students.
additional_info: Accepts dining dollars, credit/debit, and mobile payments
Daily soup and sandwich specials
Free Wi-Fi with seating for 30
Student loyalty card: every 10th coffee is free

name: Green Leaf Café
description: Green Leaf Café offers healthy and organic food options inside the main library. The menu features smoothies, grain bowls, wraps, salads, and fair-trade coffee. It provides a quieter dining option compared to the main dining hall.
additional_info: 100% organic coffee and tea selection
Gluten-free and dairy-free options available
Accepts meal plan dining dollars and all card payments
Covered beverages only allowed in library reading rooms

name: Quad Food Trucks
description: A rotating selection of 3-5 food trucks parks at the Central Quad during weekday lunch hours. Options typically include tacos, Korean BBQ, wood-fired pizza, and Mediterranean bowls. Vendors rotate weekly and schedules are posted on the campus dining website.
additional_info: Cash, credit/debit, and most mobile payment apps accepted
Weekly schedule posted at university.edu/dining/food-trucks
Outdoor picnic seating available nearby
Not available during inclement weather

name: Night Owl Express
description: Night Owl Express is a late-night food window serving pizza slices, chicken tenders, mozzarella sticks, fries, and milkshakes. It is a popular late-night option for students studying or coming back from evening activities.
additional_info: Accepts meal plan late-night swipes, dining dollars, and cards
Grab-and-go format — no indoor seating
Busiest between 10 PM and midnight
Limited menu compared to daytime options

name: Office of the Registrar
description: The Office of the Registrar handles course registration, academic transcripts, enrollment verification, and degree audits. Students can submit transcript requests, update personal information, and resolve registration holds at this office.
additional_info: Transcript requests: submit online or in person ($10 per official copy)
Enrollment verification letters: allow 3 business days
Registration holds must be cleared before enrolling in classes
Walk-in and appointment-based services available

name: Financial Aid Office
description: The Financial Aid Office assists students with scholarships, grants, loans, and work-study programs. Counselors are available for one-on-one appointments to discuss financial aid packages, FAFSA completion, and emergency funding options.
additional_info: FAFSA priority deadline: March 1 each year
Emergency micro-grants available (up to $500) — apply online
Scholarship search tool available on the financial aid website
One-on-one counseling by appointment (book online or by phone)

name: Student Services Center
description: The Student Services Center is a one-stop shop for student ID cards, parking permits, housing assignments, and general campus information. It also provides notary services and campus mail pickup for students living on campus.
additional_info: Student ID replacement: $25 fee, ready same day
Parking permits: annual ($200) and semester ($120) options
Housing assignments and room change requests processed here
Lost and found items held for 30 days

name: International Student Office
description: The International Student Office provides immigration advising, visa support, and cultural adjustment resources for international students. Services include I-20 processing, OPT/CPT authorization, and tax filing workshops for non-resident students.
additional_info: I-20 processing: allow 5-7 business days
OPT and CPT authorization handled here
Tax filing workshops for international students each spring
Buddy program pairs new international students with current students

name: Career Development Center
description: The Career Development Center offers resume reviews, mock interviews, career counseling, and job/internship postings. It hosts two major career fairs each year (fall and spring) and maintains partnerships with over 200 employers.
additional_info: Resume and cover letter reviews: drop-in or by appointment
Mock interviews available with industry professionals
Career fairs: October (fall) and February (spring)
Job board: university.edu/careers/jobs — updated weekly

name: Computer Science Department

hours.faculty_office_hours: Vary by professor — check department website

description: The Computer Science Department offers BS, MS, and PhD programs. The main office on the 3rd floor handles advising appointments, course petitions, and program information. The department has 35 full-time faculty members specializing in AI, systems, security, and software engineering.
additional_info: Department Chair: Dr. Sarah Chen (schen@university.edu), CSB 320
Academic advising: schedule at university.edu/cs/advising
Undergraduate program coordinator: Maria Lopez, CSB 301
Graduate admissions inquiries: cs-grad@university.edu

name: Engineering Department

hours.faculty_office_hours: Vary by professor — check department website

description: The Engineering Department encompasses electrical, mechanical, and civil engineering programs. The main office coordinates advising, capstone projects, and industry partnerships. The building includes dedicated lab spaces and a student project workshop.
additional_info: Department Chair: Dr. James Wright (jwright@university.edu), Eng 220
Capstone project submissions due at end of spring semester
Industry partnership coordinator: Tom Baker, Eng 205
Student chapter of IEEE and ASME meet weekly

name: Mathematics & Statistics Department

hours.faculty_office_hours: Vary by professor — check department website

description: The Mathematics & Statistics Department offers undergraduate and graduate programs in pure math, applied math, and statistics. The department runs a free Math Tutoring Center on the 1st floor of Science Hall, open to all students.
additional_info: Math Tutoring Center: Science Hall 105, Mon-Thu 10 AM - 4 PM (free)
Department Chair: Dr. Emily Zhao (ezhao@university.edu), SH 410
Statistics consulting for research projects available by appointment
Math placement exam offered during orientation and first week of classes

name: Physics Department

hours.faculty_office_hours: Vary by professor — check department website

description: The Physics Department offers BS and MS programs with research strengths in condensed matter, astrophysics, and quantum computing. The department maintains an observatory on the Science Hall rooftop open for public viewing nights once a month.
additional_info: Observatory public nights: first Friday of each month, 8-10 PM
Department Chair: Dr. Robert Kim (rkim@university.edu), SH 315
Physics tutoring available at the Math Tutoring Center
Undergraduate research positions posted at start of each semester

name: Campus Health Center
description: The Campus Health Center provides primary care, immunizations, mental health counseling, and wellness programs for enrolled students. Services are free or low-cost with a valid student ID. Walk-ins are accepted but appointments are recommended.
additional_info: Flu shots and routine immunizations available at no charge
Mental health counseling: first 6 sessions free per academic year
After-hours nurse hotline: (555) 600-7099
Pharmacy on-site for prescription pickup

name: Recreation & Fitness Center
description: The Recreation & Fitness Center offers a full gym with weight rooms, cardio equipment, an indoor pool, basketball courts, and group fitness classes. Access is included with student activity fees. Personal training sessions are available for an additional fee.
additional_info: Free for all enrolled students (included in activity fees)
Group fitness classes: yoga, spinning, HIIT, Zumba (see schedule online)
Indoor pool: lap swim hours posted at the front desk
Towel and locker rental available
Personal training: $30/session or $200 for 8-session package

name: Campus Bookstore
description: The Campus Bookstore sells textbooks, course materials, school supplies, university apparel, and electronics. It offers textbook rental and buyback programs. An online ordering option is available with in-store pickup.
additional_info: Textbook rental program saves up to 70% vs. buying new
Buyback program runs during finals week each semester
Online ordering with in-store pickup: university.edu/bookstore
10% discount on apparel during homecoming week
Accepts student account charges, financial aid bookstore vouchers, and all cards

name: IT Help Desk
description: The IT Help Desk assists students with Wi-Fi connectivity, email setup, learning management system (LMS) issues, software installation, and general tech troubleshooting. Remote support is available through the online portal for after-hours assistance.
additional_info: Free software: Microsoft Office 365, Adobe Creative Cloud, MATLAB (student license)
Wi-Fi network: connect to 'UniSecure' with your student credentials
Password resets: self-service at accounts.university.edu or visit in person with ID
Laptop repair referral program for discounted service at partner shops

name: Campus Safety & Security
description: Campus Safety & Security provides 24/7 patrol, emergency response, escort services, and safety education programs. The SafeWalk program offers after-dark escorts anywhere on campus. Emergency blue-light phones are located throughout campus.
additional_info: SafeWalk escort service: call (555) 600-7041, available 8 PM - 2 AM
Emergency blue-light phones located every 200 meters on main paths
Lost and found: items turned in are held for 30 days
Safety app: download 'UniSafe' for one-tap emergency contact and GPS location sharing

name: Student Counseling & Psychological Services
description: Student Counseling & Psychological Services offers individual counseling, group therapy, crisis intervention, and wellness workshops. All services are confidential and free for enrolled students. No referral is needed — students can schedule directly.
additional_info: First 6 individual sessions free per academic year
Crisis walk-in hours: Mon-Fri 1-3 PM (no appointment needed)
Group therapy options: anxiety, stress management, grief support
Self-help resources available at university.edu/counseling
